title: Proposing Bromo-Epi-Androsterone for Neurologic Long-COVID
content: The neurologic effects of long-COVID are a therapeutic challenge. This article discusses the immunologic manifestations of long-COVID and proposes a non-androgenic, synthetic analog of dehydroepiandrosterone (DHEA), bromo-epi-androsterone (BEA), as a candidate for clinical trials for this exigent collection of neurologic conditions. Moreover, because there is an association between long-COVID and Alzheimer’s disease, the evaluation of BEA in long-COVID may serve as a proxy for its effect on neuroinflammatory biomarkers of Alzheimer’s disease that are shared with long-COVID.
